reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for one night on 15th October 2011 as we were walking locally the next day. I can see what people are complaining about. The manager was a bit distracted when it came to admin and practical things but not so it must be said when he was serving food which he did with an enormous smile on his face. The service was a bit hit and miss at times but after a while we realised that they were a skeleton of staff who did everything and were always busy. The rooms although luwuriously done out and again with a bit of flair, were starting to looked a bit shabby around the edges. They need an odd job man to come in and tackle all of that. Having said all of that we were prepared to ignore all of that because of the stunning food in retaurant and we could see that we were staying in a special place. The Old Inn was very old and the architecture of the building and its grounds was so pleasing with it's low ceilings, big open fireplaces and cosy snug rooms. They had some nice ales on tap. It was decorated with real style and warmth using lovely colours on the walls wood and textiles and there were woollen blankets on every armchair. The restaurant is in an extension at the back of the pub and is rather like a summer house so the light streamed in. The total cost of the food inluding earlier aperetif and bar snacks for a three course meal with wine was £85 for two. For that quality it was reasonable and portions were generous. The cleanliness and bed quality were excellent and yes take ear plugs if you're a light sleeper as the rooms are close together. We loved it and you cannot beat it's close location to the very beautiful Stroud Valleys. We paid £120 for a double room

reviews.title: Disappointing & Service Nightmare

reviews.text: Booked for myself and 2 daughters for 01 Oct. Chased confirmation as they did not email. Booked horseriding in Aug for my daughters (as advertised on their website). They emailed back to say would get in touch if any problems. Phoned twice week before we were due to stay, first call the Manager was vague & said would follow up. Second call went unanswered, so emailed and agaiin, no response. When we arrived, everyone looked blank when we asked when horseriding had been booked for and it had not been booked. Very disappointing Lovely place, room very spacious and clean. Bathroom lovely. Service was very slow and when waiting to be seated in Dining Room for dinner (very pricy) staff did not acknowledge until we were seated 5 mins later. Hot starter came with cold starter 10 mins later, Kitchen had run out of items on menu. I wrote to ask for their comments & apology, no reply to date.
reviews.title: Sunday Lunch at the Ragged Cot

reviews.text: Just had the most awful Lunch with my family. The service was extremely poor and slow (meals came before any drinks and the Roast beef was so full of fat and gristle that it was barely edible and far too rare to consume (we were not asked how we wanted our meat cooked). The most annoying thing was that the staff were completely unapologetic and the second hand message from the chef seems to justify it by saying that 'it was the cut off the joint'.

Great food, new ownership
reviews.text: TheRagged Cott has recently got new owners, who have made a real difference. After reading some of the negative reviews,we were cautious about having dinner here. But the service was fantastic, a great atmosphere, and the food was delicious. Although a bit on the pricey side, it is an ideal location for a special occasion.

reviews.text: Staying in this hotel is ok, but the restaurant is not worth as food served is not of good quality

reviews.title: Has the chef gone to sleep?
reviews.text: On the Ragged Cot website, there is a picture of a homemade pie with a lovely sauce and a glass of wine. Try to order this from the menu, however, and you will be disappointed. I had high hopes of the new chef, John Jewell, but he's been here for a good few weeks now and no sign of any artistry on the menu at all. The Cot used to do brilliant food. Sadly, over the past year, it'sgone downhill and now it's little more than a grill room: three different types of steak (with chips) some sausages, fish of the day (sic) with no indication of what might accompany it, some kind of duck and a token risotto for the vegetarians. Ragged Cot management, you need to buck up before it's too late. There is absolutely no point in listing fabulous food on your website if it's not available for people to eat.

I have stayed at the Cot three times and always been very pleased. A friend and colleague lives in the area so my visits to the Cot for the practical purposes of resting for a night. None of the high expectations that come from celebrations.
reviews.title: Always pleasing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And it's great, in an unassuming kind of way. Tastefully decorated to an extent one usually has to pay several times more for. The food and wine (by the 250ml glass) are good and decent, which is what I hope for.
reviews.title: Let down, and they didn't care

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family of 4 – including 1 toddler and a baby – in one room, but found there was enough space for the z bed and travel cot, both supplied by the pub at no additional cost. The price of the room is pricey but given the area it's in – the beautiful Cotswolds – it's to be expected. The room was clean, and the bed very comfortable, and as we arrived back exhausted from a nearby relative's party we grabbed a few drinks and a snack, which they kindly took up to our room. Breakfast was delicious, although slow in parts. We left behind a babygrow, which they posted straight away to us with no hesitation. All in all, I found the staff to be friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: excellent and friendly service in lovely surroundings
Excellant newly "gastropubbed" costwold small hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night when we went to a friends party. The whole place is perfectly turned out and decorated with a very high standard of finish. The room was not large but adequate, bathroom new and very well fitted. they have spent alot of money on interior design and spent it well with high quality everywhere. The bed was very comfortable, shower powerful and room quite. No great view from the room, but the gardens are laid out very well with plenty of lawn and seating. We had lunch and breakfasty here. My pork burger topped with beetroot compote in chiabatta was very good and tastey, breakfast was a perfect English with very good ingredients.The big red strawberries and fresh thick youghat not only looked good but tasted it too. We will certainly go back. It was full the night we stayed, but everything still functioned smoothly. If you want to leave promptly in teh morning do tell them, as the from 8am breakfast start was a bit slow!! not a complaint tho. They accept dogs and have lovely sheepskin lined baskets available. Go and enjoy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice atmosphere, small bedroom, tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds. Really good breakfast and lovely friendly waitress. Very casual service from the rest of the staff.
reviews.title: Would go again

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the superior rooms. It was spacious, light and very tastefully decorated. The breakfast was delicious. We also ate in the restaurant, which I would really recommend - I had broad bean gnocci, which was a cut above usual veggie fare, and my husband's turbot apparently excellent too. Service a touch slow, but very friendly. Only criticism is that it would have been nice if the rooms had a folder with local map / walks etc. But would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent value, lovely rooms, cracking breakfast.

reviews.text: Stayed with my 71 year old Mum in a twin room ( Please be aware you have to go up a steep flight of stairs - Mum struggled and I struggled carrying all our bags!). Very nice room, well appointed with modern stylish decor, filter coffee and tea in the room was a nice touch. The weather was cool when we stayed but because the rooms are at the top of the building it was very hot even with the windows open - A fan would have been a welcome addition. Breakfast was vey nice.
reviews.title: Good Accommodation - Restaurant overpriced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my partner's birthday on a weekend in the Cotswolds. We weren't looking for luxury, just somewhere comfortable, nicely designed and with good food. The Ragged Cot looks great from its website and at some point, I expect it lived up to expectations. The room we had was spacious with lovely decor, a comfortable bed and tasteful fittings. Sadly it was also dirtry and extremely poorly maintained. The tiles in the bathroom were disgustingly stained and there was hair on the floor and in the shower. It could be a bad choice of tile is to blame, perhaps something more hardwearing would have been best but my first impression of the bathroom was 'yuk'. I moved a sheepskin rug by the bed which didn't look very clean to find an enormous stain on the carpet underneath. The paint was peeling by the extractor fan, on the windows and the nice wool blanket on the bed was covered in makeup. It was dissappointing. The food in the restaurant is actually quite good - we ate there for dinner - and the service not bad at all. It was the room that wasn't worth the pennies and the breakfast was nothing to write home about. Small things are also lacking - we asked for brown bread with our breakfast and heard the chef shout out that he didn't have any left. We expected the woman serving breakfast to come and apologise, instead, just some white plonked on the table without a word! The Ragged Cot feels like a business that has lost its way - or can't cope with the B&B side of the business as well. Call in for lunch by all means but move on somewhere else for the night!!!
reviews.title: Great idea poorly executed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ignore all the old reviews - this place has been rescued by new management! We were very impressed with the handling of a difficult situation. Our room had a plumbing issue and we were moved to another room which was also affected by the same problem.
reviews.title: Very comfortable with a great atmosphere and good food

reviews.text: As there were no other twin bedded rooms we were given two double rooms and without us asking £10 was knocked off the bill. The manageress was charming and did her best to make sure we were happy. We thought the rooms were very comfortable and for a mid-week stay very reasonable.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay with a very warm welcome from the Management

reviews.text: Do give it a try
reviews.title: Just the place to visit to relax in comfort with excellent service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I decided to get away for the New Year and having travelled to the Cotswols before we decided to head back. We trawled the internet and chose The Ragged Cot because the menu and wine list looked very different to the usual pub fare. The room in which we stayed was very clean and comfortable and was exactly what was needed after long walk in the country. The bed was so comfortable I had the best nights sleep in ages. The pub itself is what a pub should be, open fires, great beer, happy locals and friendly and attentive staff. The food was exceptional with an excellent choice of seasonal treats. During our stay we ate our way through much of the menu and found the food to be as tasty as we had hoped, the venison was the best I've eaten. The wine was fabulous and there is a variety for all tastes (ask Sebastian, one of the managers for a recommendation) I would heartily recommend the Ragged Cot to anyone for a trip away or for lunch, dinner or a pint. If you are going to visit then I would advise you to book in advance to avoid disappointment.
reviews.title: NEW OWNERS! Log fires, great food, great ales, nice staff!
